formattedAddress: 142 Sullivan St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 142 Sullivan St, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Snug choice specializing in Basque & Catalan dishes with seasonal ingredients, plus terrace seating.

originalText.text: We had such a fabulous dinner here on Saturday night. It felt like a private dining experience. The waiter was incredibly attentive and thoughtful. We had a lot of questions and he explained everything to us. He even demonstrated how to eat the barnacles without making a mess. None of us had barnacles before. The plates came out so beautifully designed but even better everything was delicious. We went to dinner thinking it would be a normal dinner and it turned into a three or four hour fun adventure! The chef was so passionate about his food and you could tell loved to just experiment with whatever was freshest. He came over and chatted with us for awhile and we loved it!! Great service, great food! Can’t wait to go back. The restaurant is very small. There is only one four seat table and two spots for bar seats with ~4-6 spots. There also is an outdoor area.

originalText.text:
Adorable! Beautiful food, friendly staff, cute decor – and tasty. Classic regional tapas, beautifully presented, and nice Spanish beverages.
It's small inside, a bit expensive (dishes add up), and taste, while fine, is not as amazing as the appearance, but overall a lovely option – a gem!

text.text:

It's small inside, a bit expensive (dishes add up), and taste, while fine, is not as amazing as the appearance, but overall a lovely option – a gem!

originalText.text: I’m so sad to see that this place is closed and I hope it’s truly only temporary. The rustic, delicious basque food is something that will live in my memory bank forever. We sat out in one of the little open booths outside and it was so quaint. We ate a whole delicious meal when we really meant to just grab a drink and some bread. The window display of the bread and the staff drew us in and we were hooked!

text.text: I’m so sad to see that this place is closed and I hope it’s truly only temporary. The rustic, delicious basque food is something that will live in my memory bank forever. We sat out in one of the little open booths outside and it was so quaint. We ate a whole delicious meal when we really meant to just grab a drink and some bread. The window display of the bread and the staff drew us in and we were hooked!

originalText.text: This was our first time having Basque cuisine. We had the octupus, sausage and iberico toast, duck, and a dessert I forgot the name of. Every course was amazing. The chef even gave us some personal attention. It was our best dining experience in New York on our current trip so far.

text.text: This was our first time having Basque cuisine. We had the octupus, sausage and iberico toast, duck, and a dessert I forgot the name of. Every course was amazing. The chef even gave us some personal attention. It was our best dining experience in New York on our current trip so far.

originalText.text:
The food is incredible and astonishing!
I personally recommend the lamb chop, which is super amazing. You can see how the chef delicately makes the dishes! Also they are very thoughtful for vegetarians (my mother in this case) to provide additional snacks for her.

I also want to thank Eddy, a very responsible, friendly, and amazing waiter! You make our visit wonderful!

Please do not hesitate to dine in! I strongly recommend Haizea for meals with friends and family!
